title: Absolutely Appalling!
body: It is almost impossible to get an appointment! You have to phone at 8.0 or 14.00. when you call at these precise times it comes back and says the queue is full call back tomorrow. I have been trying for several days now! When you call the reception outside of these hours they tell you all the appointments have gone and call back at the above times. These Doctors are failing their patients and ultimately putting peoples lives at risk!  They should be shut down and they have the gall to advertise for new patients when they do not see the patients they have. This needs to be looked at!

author: Lodwick
title: Wonderful staff
body:
Just a few words to share my immense appreciation of the staff in the Lyd unit of Derriford hospital. My sister has been transferred there following a nasty fall at home which has resulted in health issues that will require surgical intervention.  
The staff in the Lyd unit are doing a wonderful job caring for her, not only in giving the prescribed treatment but also in making her feel cared for - so important for her at this time. Thank you so much for her and from all our family. Btw, my sister also mentioned that the meals she is served are just great. Thank you again.

author: atlascx56
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: New Lease of Life
body: My breathing had not been good for the past 4/5 weeks which had left me bed bound. On arrival to DHH the care I received was excellent, nothing was too much for the nursing staff. I am determined to live my life to the fullest on my return home.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Lorri 29
title: Dying with Dignity
body:
My very frail father-in-law in his nineties was taken into ward 27 mid October with multiple ailments The ward was always very busy and at times we felt his care was lacking due to him being so frail. He took a turn for the worse, struggling to talk or even breathe. He had pneumonia and had had this previously confirmed by X-ray.  
On this afternoon doctors on the ward decided he should have a stomach x-ray due to pain in his abdomen. He was x-rayed at 16:20 and was alive, however when he was returned to ward at 18:00 hours he had passed and no one knows when. As a family we are deeply disturbed by these events and feel he deserved dignity in his passing. The ward assured us that an investigation would ensue but nearly 2 months on we have heard nothing from the RAH and NHS. Surely we deserve some sort of closure as a grieving family?

author: squatsy86
title: My faith in the NHS is restored ü•∞
body:
Slipped on the ice and broke my wrist.  
After the standard phone calls, my daughter delivered me to A&E at st John's, Livingston .  
I was triaged, x-rayed and plaster cast all within 50minutes! Wowzer, how fabulous is that üòÅüëç  
The reception staff was kind, compassionate and efficient in dealing with me.  
Nurse Paula took over thereafter. She too, was so kind and caring, thank you Paula ü§ó Amazing, spectacular service. My faith in the NHS is restored ü•∞

author: scorecardhm49
title: Lack of GP Response
body:
Not happy about the lack of response from my father's GP surgery. My father has been not well for weeks now and with discomfort in his ribs he is in totally agony. Meds aren‚Äôt helping one bit.  
I‚Äôm just totally shocked about the lack of response from the NHS. Father was last at the doctor at the start of December 2022 but since then there has been no more follow up.

author: augustzq87
title: Compassion and dedication
body: I phoned NHS 24 about my Mum. We were advised to go to A&E and they have been absolutely amazing with her. Thank you so much. You are all under so much pressure but still show compassion and dedication.

author: cepheuspt88
title: Not fit for discharge
body:
My Dad was discharged today from ward 51. It is clear that he should not have been discharged. We arrived at his house and met one of his carers. He had been left at home by patient transport when no-one else was there. His carer was very concerned at how weak he was and why he had been discharged. We got hold of the district nurse team who then contacted the ward. What appeared to be a disturbed patient answered the phone and also did so when I called later.  
The ward is adamant that my father was ambulatory and fit for discharge which is completely the opposite of what we now see. When visiting the ward during the week we could never see or speak to the one nurse who appeared to be on duty and the health care assistants were all too busy to provide any sort of update on my Dad. We are waiting with my Dad at home over the weekend in the hope that other services may be able to assist. We are terrified at the prospect of him going anywhere near ward 51 again.

author: Borders resident
title: The amazing care we recently experienced
body:
My husband has been a patient of 4 consultants at Borders General Hospital, an in-patient, at least 3 times after 999 calls, the last time in mid-December. The ambulance crew were with us within 10 mins, wonderfully professional and kind.  
The service in A&E was extraordinary. Dr Rob, Dr Catherine, & Liam - the names I remember - were all so exemplary in their care, and compassionate at the same time. Even caring for the family well being.  
It was quite a critical issue, but now thanks to the support we are receiving in Ward 6, my husband is proving medical science wrong. All the team including Becca, Liam the charge nurse, and all those whose names I have forgotten (sorry) are tremendous. They are super busy, and short-staffed, yet do not complain. They need, and deserve proper salaries, as without our health we are all nothing. Rail workers, please note. And PS, please consider opening convalescent homes to free beds for urgent specialist medical care. My thanks to all at this amazing hospital.

author: Islahula
title: Cannot praise this team enough.
body:
I had minor surgery performed at the Dermatology dept, Treliske Hospital, Truro, Cornwall. It was led by Dr Rashid with Lisa, Karen and Charlotte assisting.  
What a marvellous team! Everything was explained to me and went accordingly.  
Cannot praise this team enough. The cream of the NHS. Thank you.

author: Jay Mac
title: The staff were so thorough, uplifting and professional.
body: My teenage son suffered a head injury when he fell on ice. The care that my son received at Craigavon Area Hospital‚Äôs Paediatric department ‚ÄúBlossom‚Äù was amazing. The ward staff were just so thorough, uplifting and professional throughout. Also the paramedics and ambulance service were attentive and a lifeline. Thank you so very much!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: januarywg65
title: Lovely and welcoming
body:
Had to make an appointment for family planning at the Tamworth sexual health clinic as my doctor's could not fit me in.  
Really lovely and welcoming , there was a male HCA , I think his name was Luke could not have been more helpful.  
I had to give urine samples before I could be prescribed the contraceptive pill. He asked did I want to be screened for STI while I was there. He made me feel so at ease that I agreed. It was really quick and easy and he took the bloods himself, chatting all the time.  
The doctor, Bethany, was brilliant, she talked through the options with me, explained that I could only have the pill for 3 months because of my age but booked me in for a mirena coil to be fitted in 3 months time. Then she called me a few days later to confirm that she had checked with the consultant and they had agreed to do it. Really helpful. Very non judgemental.  
She also gave me condoms to use in the time between my pill running out and my coil bring fitted.

author: Time wasted
title: Wasting my time
body:
I tried to get advice from NHS 24. I stayed on the line for 2 hours, only to be cut off  
So caring?  
2 hours wasting my time and then someone cut me off.  
That put me back in a queue for a 3 hour wait. How is that helpful?  
Who are employed at this help line? Who is responsible for this charade?  
I find it a complete nonsense. No wonder the NHS is in the state it's in if they can't even answer a phone.

author: Ellex64
title: Rescheduling an appointment
body:
I have been offered an appointment at the Cullen Centre (finally after a three month wait) and I need to cancel it as I have had to return to London for a funeral and for Christmas. I have tried to contact them to cancel and reschedule for a whole week and I am failing to get through. The phone always rings and I always leave a message but no calls have been returned.  
I really need this appointment and I don‚Äôt want to miss out on the opportunity to get due to a lack of miscommunication. There is no email address for them anywhere either which is very stressful and certainly not helping my problems surrounding stress and eating.

author: December@22
title: Being diagnosed with an over active thyroid
body:
Dr Dash at Blackwood Medical Centre was very prompt after my blood results showed I had an over active thyroid. He quickly referred me to Dr Hill at endocrinology at Wishaw General Hospital - as this was through the pandemic I was seen virtually. Dr Hill investigated thoroughly what was causing my thyroid issues and it was discovered I had nodules on my thyroid gland. He gave me my options for treatment and I decided to try the Radio Iodine treatment, which he then referred me to Dr Mukhopadhyay at Monklands hospital.  
Again I was seen quickly and 6 weeks later I was treated with Radio Iodine treatment at Monklands Hospital. I was quite anxious about this treatment but Dr Mukhopadhay and the doctors at Monklands Hospital did everything to put my mind at ease. I had no negative side effects of the radio iodine treatment apart from having to stay isolated from others for three weeks.  
The follow up appointment with Nurse Kerry to get my bloods taken have shown that my bloods are now normal and at this stage it looks like the radio iodine has done exactly what it was intended for and my thyroid is working normally at the moment. Future blood tests will determine whether this continues. However I am hopeful.  
Thank you again for all those individuals involved in my care and to NHS Lanarkshire in keeping me well informed and part of the process of my care.

author: frostde44
title: Down to Earth Gynaecology Consultant
body: Was put on a 2 week wait ,on the day of my appointment the consultant Sarah was very down to earth and after an examination I had my treatment and am very pleased with the outcome. Nothing was too much trouble. many thanks to Sarah and Dawn

author: Sfergie89
title: Everything I dreaded about labour I didn‚Äôt want, happened
body:
I went into have my baby last week after having the cook balloon placed. My first midwife I had was fantastic couldn‚Äôt fault her at all.  
My second midwife for the last part started off fine but as the night went on I felt I was putting her out her way. She was more interested in getting her notes done than anything else.  
I had been following hypnobirthing and doula advice throughout my pregnancy and breathing techniques to be then told to push as if I‚Äôm constipated, chin to chest and hold my breath without being able to take a breath back in resulting in me spewing (also that seemed to annoy her too) I ended up getting forceps, episiotomy and then opened up again to get my placenta removed in theatre.  
Everything I dreaded about labour I didn‚Äôt want had happened to me which has made me still in agony and not able to enjoy my newborn when I‚Äôm still unfit and mentally has affected me. I personally think midwife‚Äôs like her should get her head out a book from the dark ages and into a hypnobirthing one and rethink her methods.  
If I had the first midwife for the second part I feel things would‚Äôve went smoother. Even my forceps midwife had to tell the second midwife to get out of the room.  
Another staff member was brilliant also. Disappointed in my experience I never want to endure that again.  
For a happy time of year I feel truly awful.

title: Wonderful Staff
body: I came into the A&E 17th December evening with a very bad wound to my head. The department was extremely busy. But the care that the they gave everyone was phenomenal. Thank you for the wonderful care you gave to me & my wife. You all went above & beyond. Please pass this on to your staff how thankful I am.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding practice
body: The partners and staff at Park and St Francis surgeries provide an exceptional service. I have felt respected, valued and cared for. I have been treated as an equal and have been listened to and heard which is a rare quality these days and especially in a busy practice. Many thanks for all you do to care and support us so well.

title: Good practice
body: I sent my Dr details of 5 days B/P readings and within a few days she had reviewed and sent me details of my new medication.

title: Excellent treatment
body:
I had a small implant put in by the nurse led clinic.  Three nurses took care of me from getting me ready to discharging me.  

The treatment I received was excellent, the nurses were kind, considerate and friendly.  They were caring, very concerned that I should know what was going to happen during and after the procedure.  

The machinery was set up for me and its use explained, I feel very, very fortunate to have such equipment available to me.

I wish I could thank these three ladies by name.  Kindness and compassion go such a long way and are so appreciated.  Thank you.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Grateful that this is my surgery
body: My family and I have been with this surgery for several years and the care is excellent. Whenever any of of us have needed an appointment or prescription we have obtained it very quickly. All members of staff are friendly and professional. Whenever we have needed to be referred it has been done efficiently. The online consult is excellent. The receptionists, HCAs, nurses and GPs are wonderful. You feel as if they care. I  feel very lucky.

title: Wonderful Service
body: I went along to the hospital because a wound was not healing and giving me cause for concern, and, my doctors' surgery is out of county. I was seen quickly and given proper care and attention. I cannot fault the staff or the service given. Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant care
body: I attended Sanderson ward as a day care patient to have cystoscopy under general anaesthesia, I was very nervous and scared. From the time I stepped into the ward, which is a very warm welcoming place, I was looked after, all the nurses were so friendly and caring, they put me at ease immediately, all procedures were carried out professionally, from the waiting to be taken to theatre, to the surgeon who explained everything to me so that I understood what was happening, to the brilliant anaesthetist, who was caring and funny and immediately put me at ease, to the nurse who was with me in recovery and gave me my first drink of water, to the staff back at Sanderson, where I had sandwiches and tea from a lovely nurse, I was checked continually throughout my recovery and subsequent discharge. All of the nursing staff were so friendly, I cannot express how grateful I am and how safe I felt I knew I was in good hands the whole day, so thanks to all who looked after me, you do make a difference to people's lives when they are scared and apprehensive, hope you all have a brilliant Christmas you deserve it

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great Practice
body:
All the staff have always been friendly, supportive and helpful.

I have always been able to get telephone or face to fave appointments, when needed.

title: Excellent staff
body:
I called 111 two days ago an spoke to a nurse. Despite informing her of the neglectfulness I have expirecnced through she did not judge. She just listened.

Most nurse don't like hearing the truth but this particular nurse did not let it affect her judgement. Despite some of the information being incriminating towards her job.

This shows experience. And very good people skills.

We need more nurse who listen to patients rather than ignoring patients concerns to save their job.

title: Good experience
body: I was enrolled with the Insomnia Clinic and had numerous telephone appointments.  I had suffered from severe insomnia and relying on sleeping tablets.  The care and instruction was excellent and my sleep has been improved tremendously.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very Good.
body: Although continuing the face obvious pressures in the NHS generally you genuinely feel the doctors, nurses and all other staff are trying to do all they can with the resources available to them. Seem to make effective use of available technology. Have always found them to be professional yet friendly.

title: Very satisfied patient
body:
Tamworth House Medical Practise provides a great service and I have no complaints whatsoever. The receptionists have always treated me well. They always answer the phone in a timely manner when the NHS is under extreme pressure. They are polite and respectful and do whatever is possible. I was recently referred to WideWay Hub same day appointment which suited me perfectly  and not very far
I didn‚Äôt have to take time off from work. Perfect. The Doctors are great to. Never had a problem with them. Great listening and communication skills. I really can‚Äôt say one bad word about the service

title: Fabulous A&E
body: From start to finish we had excellent care all though a long wait due to the volume of patients but heyhoo we were prepared to wait due to being informed and updated to the situation throughout our care from reception nurses cleaners doctors and security for keeping us all safe etc thank you all

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Thom25
title: Potentially fatal Subarachnoid hemorrhage.
body:
I've had the worst experience I've ever had with NHS Scotland. On Friday evening I was diagnosed with a potentially life threatening condition called subarachnoid hemorrhage. My GP immediately told me to go to A&E at the royal infirmary  
On arrival I found that the GP had not bothered to even write this in my notes so I was triaged for 8.5 hours for a brain injury. I finally got a CT scan but the Dr noted as its taken so so so so long to get the scan done it's not conclusive.  
I was then told to come back at 9am for a lumbar puncture. On arrival I was told I would have to wait a few hours. I finally got my appointment (meant for 9am) at 16:15 where sadly I couldn't go ahead with it due to extreme fear and anxiety. I wasn't allowed to do it under general anesthetic because there was noone to do it.  
So now I've been told just to randomly phone back on Monday morning to book this in. If I have a subarachnoid hemorrhage I could in fact be dead by then. I have never been so scared in my entire life. From the reception staff to the nurses to the Doctors, I have been treated extremely poorly and with often a lot of rudeness.  
I am now sitting about my house in constant full panick mode because I have been left to possibly die.

title: Great practice
body: This practice has given me all the help and support and attention when I needed it over the past 15 years. My Doctor is just great, thank you.

title: Prompt and Efficient GP Service
body:
I had a concerning mole on my back and was able to see a doctor within two days. He was concerned. Within two weeks I had a Dermatology consultation and minor surgery. A fantastic response. Horn Lane, like every other practice, is a busy surgery but I find the receptionists make time for me and are helpful. 
It is frustrating that on less urgent or chronic complaints, it is difficult to get a face to face appointment but I don‚Äôt think, from what I hear, that that is unique to this GP practice.
 Well done Horn Lane, keep up the good work and thank you.

title: Great practice
body:
Polite staff and prompt response. I was able to get an appointment on the same day. 
I was able to discuss my concerns and worries and staff were able to support this and help come to a conclusion

title: Very satisfied patient
body:
Tamworth House Medical Practise provides a great service and I have no complaints whatsoever. The receptionists have always treated me well. They always answer the phone in a timely manner when the NHS is under extreme pressure. They are polite and respectful and do whatever is possible. I was recently referred to WideWay Hub same day appointment which suited me perfectly  and not very far
I didn‚Äôt have to take time off from work. Perfect. The Doctors are great to. Never had a problem with them. Great listening and communication skills. I really can‚Äôt say one bad word about the service

author: Somamohamed93
title: Giving birth
body:
I was a week overdue my pregnancy. I went into hospital with concerns to baby's movement. When I went I was already in labour and was moved to Labour Ward. I had an amazing midwife who looked after me well. She went above and beyond for me. I asked for epidural but the anaesthetist was struggling to find the right spot and stopped after 10 times trying. I was in so much pain and wanted the epidural so badly, therefore my midwife fought for me to have another try in the theatre room.  
My baby's heartbeat was down and up and there were 2 senior doctors in the room, but they just put the pressure on the midwife. Even when the midwife was asking for help they didn‚Äôt provide her with support. My baby was born and was not breathing. My midwife was trying to make the baby breathe, whereas the senior doctors were just watching and not helping out, even though she shouted for help. My husband had to press the emergency button as my midwife was holding the baby and trying to get her breath back.  
I was in total shock with the senior doctors' reactions. They did not write anything up for me for records apart from my midwifes notes.  
I feel the senior doctors should have helped the midwife more. In my view, it's due to their lack of support that my baby had kidney failure and had to stay in hospitals for weeks in special care

title: Christmas Time
body:
I just want to say a big thank you to all the staff who I spoke to yesterday. I brought my daughter in. Reception staff were amazing, polite and accommodating right down to finding me a plastic cup to enable my daughter to provide a sample.
The doctor was so very thorough. It was such a busy day for the surgery but I cannot fault your help and kindness.

title: Always outstanding
body: Even under such pressure this practice always goes above and beyond to help all its patients. I am so grateful for the practice and all its staff, recently helping me with lots of appointments I needed to make after a nasty illness. Wishing them all a merry Christmas and a happy new year.

title: Great staff
body: All the staff from the porters to , nurse‚Äôs and Doctors were so caring, helpful and professional on a very very busy night in A and E . They were all doing their best in exceptional circumstances to ensure all the patients were cared for and looked after . I can not fault the care my mum received.

readBy.name: Milton Keynes University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body:
Amazing caring doctors and staff . Reception staff extremely efficient and polite . 
Lucky to be a patient at this practice !

title: Brilliant practice.
body: Needed to talk to a GP and got a same day call back. The GP was excellent very understanding caring and very easy to talk to. Quickly sorted out my health concerns and got me the medication and support I needed. Thankyou so much.

title: Quick response
body: Applied for a sick note and received a call the following morning, very quick and simple with the doctor being very understanding.

title: Great Gp
body:
This GP service is better than other. They response patient very cordially 
I am very happy for our GP service & advice 
Thanks GP

title: Very positive
body: I had a cataract operation on my left eye 5 days ago. I was very impressed by the speed and professionalism of the procedure. After a couple of days the vision in the eye was markedly improved. I eagerly anticipate having my other eye treated.

author: octoberen98
title: They kept us sane
body:
After the birth of my son he was rushed to the Neonatal ICU in Craigavon. As a first time mum this was a very scary and daunting situation to find myself & son in. However, all my worries went away when I first went down to visit him and I seen the level of care and compassion the staff had towards not only my son but every baby and their parents.  
After a 10 day stay he finally got to come home and I cannot thank all the staff in Neonatal enough. Special thanks to Elaine, Jenni, Chloe, Hannah, Lyndsey & Donal and all the other staff we met over the course of his unexpected stay in Neonatal. They kept us sane and really made the past 10 days a lot easier than it would‚Äôve been without them! So glad to have my wee man home!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Happy with the care
body:
After being in hospital from Thursday due to a variety of issues, I can safely say I am very happy with the care I have been receiving in the Acute Medical Unit. The staff have been really helpful and attentive- which has put me at ease. The food is extremely nice, much nicer than I had anticipated. As well as this, the hygiene around my bed and the ward is super.  
I feel I am informed regularly of my progress and doctor's come around on the daily. The only thing I would say is that despite the toilet/ shower room being labelled as ''disabled'', there are no rails present, which is something I would question. Other than that, I am content in AMU.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been lovely
body:
I arrived into 1 north on Tuesday morning with a suspected heart attack and got a stent put into place. I am hoping to get out this evening, so am delighted to be home before Christmas.  
The staff have been lovely- very pleasant and helpful. In addition, the food has been great, the variety and selection is first-class. I have no complaints regarding the cleanliness of the ward, and equally the facilities. I am happy with the care I have received and am just waiting on the pharmacist to come with my medication.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They couldn't do enough for you
body:
I came into hospital 2 weeks ago on a Saturday morning due to shortness of breath, chest pains and a persistent cough I was experiencing. I have to say that the staff have been phenomenal, they couldn't do enough for you and are extremely approachable.  
I want to mention in particular, the doctors and consultants who come to see me because they are open to any question and will put things into layman's terms. I really feel respected by the staff and am treated with dignity. The hygiene in the ward is good and the cleaners do a thorough job. The food is nice and I am pleased with the selection that is available. The one thing I have remarked on is the benefit of ''being in the system'' as such. As in, being in hospital has enabled me to be checked out for other problems by specialist consultants- for example, consultants in cardiology and rheumatology were on hand to do a full check. Even in terms of tests/scans, which you can receive that day. Whereas, if I was an outpatient, the waiting list could potentially be months.  
The ward has also been quite liberal with visitors which has really made my time more pleasant as I am able to see my family. Overall, I am delighted with the care I have received in 1 North and want to thank all the staff.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff go above and beyond
body: The care that I have been getting in ramone has honestly been very good and the treatment that I have been given since I was admitted has been absolutely excellent. The staff have been key in making me feel better over the past few days they go above and beyond every day and I really couldn‚Äôt ask for a better support system to look after me. They deserve better level of pay and Have been absolutely brilliant with me. Communications also been excellent im always updated if something changes. I have had no issues at ask and im very happy with everything

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have been treated very well in the hospital
body: I have been treated very well in the hospital and the care has been at a very decent level. The staff have been amazing with me so far like I honestly don‚Äôt have a bad word to say about how they have been treating me so far. The treatment however has been very difficult to figure out and I am feeling very unwell in the hospital. They are explaining everything but I am feeling unwell, it has been torture and despite the care being a high quality I still feel very unwell. I have had no issues with the way I have been treated.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A pleasent experience
body: The care has been pretty okay so far really don‚Äôt think that I have anything to complain about as I have been treated pretty well so far. The staff have been okay like can‚Äôt really be that displeased with them they are very polite and do an absolutely great job with everyone especially the explanations who are very easy to understand me very easily as they can aim treatment at me very well. The foods honestly been pretty well with the menu system being great ordering what if want and when. I Have had no issues with my care im honesty very happy with it all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Ease of accessibility to queries
body:
On contacting a virus and being very unwell I tried to telephone the Winterbourne to inform them that I could not attend for minor surgery tomorrow morning. I was transferred a call centre who said they would deal with my query .
They also said no one was available to deal with my information.I find this unacceptable.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Have been quite happy with the care
body: The care that up have been getting has honestly been pretty decent so far and honestly I think that I have been treated very well in the hospital it‚Äôs been a present experience. I have been treated absolutely great by all of the staff they have all been pretty amazing so far. They are so much and have been incredibly kind I am honestly very happy with all of them. They have been very easy to understand as explanations have all been pretty decent I understand most of what they sat with no real issues. I‚Äôm honestly quite happy with my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The care has been absolutely great
body: The care has been absolutely great so far and I really cannot complain about the way I have been treated. So far there‚Äôs not a bad word that I could say about the staff they have all been so kind. Nurses are always there checking up on me give me medication with the domestic also being so helpful and any food or drinks that I need they are always so helpful and polite about it. Doctors give me great communication and having them explain my treatment puts me a lot more at ease. Honestly though I have had no issues with the care I have been getting

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: MGJC
title: Non-judgemental and genuine support
body:
My mother has been diagnosed with a rare form of Leukaemia and both she and us as a family have received wonderful care and support as we have all done our best to come to terms with the diagnosis and then to begin to try to figure a way forward.  
The support has been non-judgemental and genuine.

title: How could what was a wonderful surgery sink so low
body: I have been a user of brailsford practice for over 60years it was always a first class doctors until the last couple of years. Then things fell apart I have had many negative experiences in recent times but will just concentrate on today's issue in the hope it will bring about positive change. This morning I called to pick up a repeat prescription and found there were 30 people  waiting to be served as I had to be elsewhere I decided to call later in the afternoon . some five hours on my return there were now 31waiting.over the next hour we move toward slower that snails pace.there were some very unhappy people waiting. I noted that when each in turn reached the head of the queue they were told that their prescription was not even ready and they were given the paperwork to take to a chemist (this has happened to myself on five previous occasions) very occasionally did someone actually walk away with medication. With growing trepidation I reached I reached the head of the queue, and miracle I actually received my medication yes I was lucky this  time, but overall the dispencery service is appalling. At one time as I collected my monthly prescription, the date of the next collection was written on the bag and the details entered into the dispensary computer. Now we have the ludicrous situation wehere we have to drop the request in the box a week before( for myself this involves a 12 mile round trip 12times a year ,what a waste of time and fuel). The overall situation is so appealing its perhaps time that what are numerous dissatisfied patients (you only need to look at these review pages)came together to to demand some very urgent changes to the way what was in the past a very well  run practice ,which has now become an absolute shambles

author: Magbp36
title: The staff are very nice, friendly and professional
body:
I had my booster Covid vaccination at the Lynebank Hospital vaccination centre in Dunfermline. It's a drop-in clinic, so I was worried about the queues, but there was no waiting. The staff are very nice, friendly and professional, got my vaccine within minutes of arrival and was asked to stay for 15 mins after to make sure there's no adverse reaction.  
The do close for lunch 12:30-13:30.

title: Utterly disgraceful
body: I called the surgery with regards a suspected case of Strep a in my child. I was kept waiting 20 minutes to be told there were no appointments. They told me to call 111. I was kept waiting a further 20 minutes and 111 told me they would instruct my gp to put us on the emergency call list. Nobody called me back. My child remains extremely unwell and you wonder why people end up in a&e. I am appalled that despite recent warnings about Strep a and instructing parents to contact gps and having received a letter from my child‚Äôs school telling us there was an outbreak in his class- this was a public health letter) also instructing to contact the gps

title: Safety concern
body:
I went to visit my mother in Rainbow ward this evening. It is the first time I‚Äôve been to this hospital besides A&E on Saturday evening, no problems there.
I have never seen anything like it before, patients in room alone with just a button to press for help. 
My mother‚Äôs  button was way out of reach for her and even if it was nearby she was too unwell to use or understand what it was for. 
When I got there her bed sheets were soaked and she needed changing, I asked how it works in the ward, I thought maybe they were being monitored by cctv. 
I was told they just have to press the button for help. 
Also the bed was high and my mum is high risk for falls. She could have very easily got out of the bed or rolled off it if she was
a little more her usual self. 
When I got home I called the ward three times but no answer, I called the switchboard and was told rainbow ward never answers the phone even for them. 
It was also quite cold in the room
She was in which is very unusual for hospitals. 
I think I‚Äôm going to have a sleepless night tonigh worrying about my mum. 
I will never use have my mum in this hospital again. 
I‚Äôm seriously concerned for her safety.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff have been so good with me
body: There‚Äôs only one word to describe the care that I have been experiencing and that is absolutely brilliant. Staff have been so good with me, their kindness everyday goes above and beyond with them setting such high standards of themselves, always finding the time to check up on me or get me absolutely anything that I need. They do an amazing job day in day out I couldn‚Äôt ask for better to be honest. The food that I get actually isn‚Äôt bad like the menu has decent variety and im honestly very happy with everything I‚Äôve seen

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: JeanieJo
title: I cannot fault my care
body:
I had very urgent cataract surgery a couple of weeks ago. I cannot fault my care or the nurses/doctors involved. When I was in discomfort during the procedure, I was listened to.  
My only complaint is that the main preparation area was really cold and the offer of a warm drink after the procedure would have been most welcome. As it was, I had to request a drink (cold water given)

title: Poor practice
body: Your Review:  I have ongoing mental health issues, which require medication monitoring and being passed from pillar to post with this surgery is completely unacceptable. After 111 due to a week of 8am no appointments script, again passed around from number to number. In 2022 how is it a surgery is in such woeful state of affairs. Why has it become ‚Äúbest practice‚Äù ringing and running the 8am que. We‚Äôre are the GP‚Äôs ? I personally have been and sat in an empty waiting room, and still waited 30mins over my appointment time??? Would not be accepted in other business, this poor standard, and I‚Äôm a patient person, which has finally run out.

title: Telephone appointments are still a nightmare
body:
Appointment system is awfull
Ring at 8am just to get told no appointments left today ring tomorrow.
The doctors do seem nice when you get to see them .
but the reception staff seem to think they are trained medical staff who can decide if you are ill enough to see a doctor and always ask why you want to see the doctor ..patient confidentiality is awfull .
Last time I had to speak to doctor via a phone call .
my Priscriptions always get lost on the way to the chemists.
Blood test appointments take 4 weeks to get from the nearby health centre.
Parking is awfull when busy round the back of the surgery.
Since covid this surgery has gone down a lot

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Absoutley great so far
body: The care in 4 south has been absolutely great so far and I honestly don‚Äôt think there is much more the staff could do to make me feel better. They are all extremely nice always introduce themselves and just in general do a very good job with their communication everything‚Äôs explained any questions answered that type of stuff. Just generally great and have been so quick on anything that I need, Everything‚Äôs been pretty great I am honesty happy enough with the care I have been getting

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Toddler's Parents
title: Far more care and attention should have been given.
body:
My 18 month old son was brought into A&E via ambulance due to pyrexia which caused febrile convulsions.  
The paramedic who first saw over a video call that our son was limp and unresponsive decided their most urgent response was necessary. They arrived at our house quickly. He was then quickly taken into the ambulance to be assessed enroute. Thankfully, he became responsive and more alert whilst in the ambulance.  
We arrived at A&E and he was taken into resus to be closely observed as the A&E staff felt he was too unstable for their general area due to his continued high heart rate, temperature, and recent convulsions.  
Over an hour after being in A&E it was identified that it was best for him to be assessed by a paediatric doctor however there were no beds in paediatric assessment. We waited for a further 2 and half hours to be moved to the Paediatric Assessment Unit. Once there, a Health Care Support Worker took his observations and stated he had a high heart rate (170) and temperature (39.6). It was also noted at this point that the red side of his face was red, swollen and hot to the touch. We requested Paracetamol as he was already overdue having had his first and only one of the day at home a couple of hours before we got to A&E. It took over an hour, and ourselves requesting on a total of 3 occasions, to get Paracetamol for a toddler whose temperature was 39.6 and who was actively rigoring. When the Paracetamol was finally given the nurse handing it to us said that it was only prescribed 25 minutes ago. I would have thought it would be a priority to give him Paracetamol as the reason he was in hospital was due to pyrexia and febrile convulsion. We then got seen by a junior doctor who did a very brief assessment. During the assessment they asked my toddler to open his mouth while they pointed a wooden stick at him. His response was to shut his mouth so they gave up despite me requesting to help. They ended their assessment stating they would report to a more senior doctor their findings and they would formulate a plan.Half an hour later we asked if he would be reviewed soon and were told the doctor was cannulating a patient on the ward and would see us after that. It was also around this time we saw and heard the junior doctor who had reviewed our son talking loudly and with a nurse about another patient.After what had now been a 1 hour wait from anyone last laying eyes on our son, with an ill and tired toddler, and it being near midnight, we decided it would be best to go home and manage his fever at home as his pyrexia was resolving and we could hopefully manage this better with regular Paracetamol at home. When we told the nurses we were going home they said the doctor will be shortly. There is an ill patient being seen currently. We explained our reasons for wanting to go home - that we had been in hospital for just under 6 hours and no test, swab, bloods or anything meaningful had been done except a quick examination by a junior doctor who we felt was incompetent at examining a toddler - and asked what their opinion was from their assessment and they said they had wrote "query viral infection." When we asked how they had decided it was viral and not bacterial without a proper review or any tests at all the senior charge nurse answered that he "looks viral" and they were happy for us to go. Adding that if the doctor felt he had needed seen then he would have been seen by now.The next day we took our son to the GP. Within a matter of minutes of laying eyes on our son he diagnosed him with having tonsillitis, and prescribed him antibiotics. He was so apologetic about our experience and said if anyone had carried out a proper assessment, or simply bothered to look in his mouth, it would have been very obvious he had tonsillitis. He stated he had very visible large white spots on both tonsils. The fever, and red, swollen, hot left cheek should have been a clear indicator also. With tonsillitis normally being caused due to Strep-A bacteria which it is being widely reported that many children are currently suffering from this should have been diagnosed much, much earlier. If we had not taken it upon ourselves to go and see the GP the next day our son would have still never received any antibiotics. We are vastly disappointed by his care in the Paediatric Assessment Unit. We feel that the medical and nursing staff should have given far more care and attention to our son. They should be more vigilant of the Strep-A outbreak and realise how detrimental it can be to misdiagnose a bacterial infection as viral on a toddler.

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff doing great under immense strain
body:
After having a heart attack, I needed to get an ambulance to the Royal Victoria Hospital. The ambulance staff were absolutely 100%. Everything over in the Royal was ok and they checked me out alright.  
I was then transferred over to Daisy Hill's Male Medical Ward where I am now. It has been dead on here. The only issue was that there had been a miscommunication and they were not aware that I was coming and so I had to wait in the hall whilst a bed became available, which I didn't mind too much. The staff up here have all been absolutely great. I really cannot say a bad word about the staff - they are doing great under immense strain. I couldn't name any staff member over the other as they have all been excellent.  
The ward itself has been both comfortable and clean. All the food I get is always good as well.  
The only thing I can think of that could be improved is that there is a draft coming through the window that could be looked at.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff have so much time for me
body:
The care that I have been getting since being admitted after into here a month ago. I was originally admitted here after a week in CAH after a fall. I found it would be nice however the staff were always very busy and very rarely had they a lot of time for patients.  
However, in here it‚Äôs a lot less busy and the staff have a lot more time for us patients which I feel goes a long way as I feel I know the staff better. I gave been recovering well in here everyone‚Äôs very friendly and the foods lovely to be honest. Everything‚Äôs very good and the only issue I had was not being able to sleep at the start however now that‚Äôs fixed

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: lynxzb94
title: The best support imaginable.
body:
I've been waiting for a colonoscopy for quite a while and had built up quite a bit of panic in my head.  
The prospect of what the results may bring added to my anxiety about that whole process.  
The team at Ninewells endoscopy department were all absolutely amazing and caring throughout.  
They talked to me openly and honestly and tied their very best to allay the fears I had.  
The procedure itself has not much more than 20 minutes and while not comfortable Mr Kallachill and the wonderful doctors/nurses with him (I'm sorry if didn't catch names) did a wonderful job of trying to calm me from the panic I had allowed overcome me.  
While I'll have a wait to find out results from biopsies I just wanted to say thank you so much to everyone that was on this morning and how much you helped. I'm in your debt and you are in my thanks.  
A colonoscopy is not a pleasant experience, starting with the cleansing process the day before but with wonderful care staff like those at Ninewells people can feel assured they are in great hands and you'll get the best support imaginable.  
Thank you Endoscopy Ninewells üôèüèªüëè‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Matdw53
title: Staff so kind towards me
body: The care in the hospital has all been very great so far and I really cannot complain about how the hospital has been. The care in Loane house from the staff have really all been pretty decent I am honestly very happy with all of them. They all do a pretty good job talk away and have all been very kind towards me. They are amazing at explaining things and communication has been a brilliant part of what they do. Food in the hospitals honesty been amazing like I really enjoy it to be honest good portions too. I have no issues so far I am happy enough with everything

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Vian74
title: Happy about my recent visit
body:
I was very happy and satisfied with service and treatment I received for my last visit which was mid December with Ms Diomande.  
She is a very nice lady who is very hard-working. I have known her for so many years, working and helping at reception, answering calls and caring for patients so they receive best service and treatment. I was so happy to see her as a nurse üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è. She did my blood test and has got very soft hands - everything was pain free and also a nice welcoming face ..thanks a lot

author: Matdw53
title: Care that I have been getting in Loane house has been pretty good so far
body: Care that I have been getting in Loane house has been pretty good so far really no issues about what I have seen so far. The staff that I have been looking after me and no matter what their role domestics, doctors, nurses mats any of them have been absolutely lovely so far and all do an absolutely brilliant. Understanding them is all easy as they speak clearly and in a way that I can understand so I know what happening with my treatment. I am happy enough with my care just wish I could get rid of this flu so in could get my discharge in time for Christmas

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Pixiepooh
title: Labour and postnatal care
body:
I can't thank the staff enough for my care both during labour and my postnatal care. Every staff member I came across were so lovely and compassionate and resulted in a very positive birth experience.  
I have to say a special thanks to both Holly and Chloe. They were both really encouraging throughout my labour and helped me so much more than they realised. I'm still so impressed that they were both newly qualified. Also thank you to Susan and Gillian who were also so encouraging. My husband really appreciated how kind Susan was towards him.  
Also a massive thank you to Claire from my post natal care. She listened to me and advocated for me when I needed her to and I'll be forever thankful for that.  
My little girl is doing so well and a part of that was how I was treated throughout my care in Wishaw. I had such a positive experience that it's had a positive effect on my little girl.  
Thank you again to every staff member that I came across during my stay.

author: Asdfgh12345
title: ‚ÄúWe all die sometime‚Äù
body:
My dad has been investigated for enlarged abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) for last 2-3 years. He was diagnosed with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis approx 1.5-2 years ago.  
His ultrasounds showed its getting bigger each time, he broached the subject of surgery when diagnosed with pulmonary fibrosis but was told it wasn‚Äôt big enough to operate.  
We have an extensive family history of ruptured AAA, where my gran died of this and my uncle had been operated so we know that my dad would eventually need operated for this.  
Last month he had his ultrasound and meeting with surgeon where he was told that it was now at the size to operate but surgeon said that he wouldn‚Äôt as he would be at risk of dying.  
My dad wants the operation instead of waiting about for it to sudden rupture and then die. But the surgeon didn‚Äôt want to discuss further and stated that we all die sometime, a horrible thing to say to someone who has been given such bad news.  
My dad has never had any issues with his pulmonary fibrosis and had never been admitted to hospital with it and his 02 levels are always with normal range.  
The way he has been treated is disgusting and hope this surgeon is spoken to about this and hope no one else has to encounter this uncaring person.

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Nurses really couldn't do enough for me
body:
After collapsing following a cardiac episode, I was admitted onto Daisy Hill Hospital's Coronary Care Ward where I have been for the last 12 weeks. My experience began in the Emergency Department. It was great here and all the staff were good. I was seen to quite quickly but I did have to wait a while for my bloods to come back.  
It has been absolutely brilliant on Coronary Care. The nurses really couldn't do enough for me. The staff all have a good attitude - great in fact. They also always make sure to take their time and explain everything very clearly. couldn't single anybody out in particular as they have all been good. The toilets have been kept clean and the food has been good.  
I have no suggestions for improvement - except the fact that there were no ambulances that could come to me in time to bring me to the hospital. Everything else has been grand.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: jrey286
title: Fantastic Care
body:
My Mum was visited on Thursday 15 December by the District Nurse Rosaleen McNally and (I think a student called Grace), they were from the Downe.  
I can honestly say they were both brilliant, my mother was in a lot of pain and they really reassured her. High class service. I was very impressed.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: equuleusdj33
title: Interventional radiology
body: I had a fistuloplasty. I had superb staff treatment especially from the doctor msrzoug and his team in December 2022

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

author: snowce96
title: My stay on this ward really has been first class.
body:
All the girls on the Daisy Paediatric Ward have been absolutely lovely. My mood has been up and down just being stuck in the one room but my stay on this ward really has been first class.  
The staff on the ward really have been lovely. I have a soft wee place for Laura, Alana and Ciara who were all really excellent. All the staff have had a really great attitude apart from one specific nurse - I dread it when she is on.  
The ward has been very comfortable and it is always kept incredibly clean. All the cleaning staff have also been lovely. The room itself is also very nice.  
I have nothing to suggest that needs improving - except maybe a couple of hangers in the wardrobe.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tina 237
title: Friendly and professional CBT therapist
body:
A GP referred me to Talk Together for support with my anxiety which had led to a relapse of chronic fatigue. I was lucky to be placed with Annabelle who was friendly, organised calm and professional.  
She gave me some great strategies for dealing with anxiety and it has been significantly reduced so hopefully I will gradually recover from the relapse in CFS (Chronic fatigue syndrome).  
Thank you so much Annabelle

author: Jean2022
title: Excellent care & nursing
body:
Re Stepping Hill Hospital, Stockport  
My husband, in his seventies, was sent to A & E at Stepping Hill Hospital last Saturday suffering from suspected appendicitis. The wait in A & E was much less than what we expected because of the football match between England & France! The relevant investigations were done calmly & efficiently. He was admitted to the SSU Ward later in the evening having had a CT scan to confirm the diagnosis. The staff were caring & considerate & made time to explain the situation & what would happen.  
Due to emergencies he was not able to have the operation on Sunday but the reasons were explained by the very busy surgeon. The operation was performed on the Monday & the care in the ward was excellent.  
My husband was then moved to Ward D26 where the care continued.  
I cannot praise the surgeon, nursing staff & those working on the wards enough. We hear so much about the faults of the NHS. They were not obvious in this case.  
Many thanks.

author: Josts49
title: Great team!!
body:
I had a CT Colonoscopy last week at Wythenshawe Hospital.  
I just want to thank all members of staff for their fantastic assistance, support & help through the procedure. It was a few minutes of discomfort but their warm and professional attitude helped me considerably and made things much easier.  
Thanks again!!

title: Awful
body:
Awful surgery, started calling at 08:00am didn‚Äôt get through until 11:45am even used the web form and they managed to respond to that before answering the phone, which they suggested I called the surgery for an appointment. Seriously that is what they advised, come on Windsor house I am hold waiting to book an appointment. Once I finally spoke to a human they advised no appointments left and to try again the following day. The admin staff are useless, no idea about the actual doctors or nurses as I have never seen one and had to resort to an online doctor and paid for the service. 
What is the point of registering with the doctors if you can‚Äôt get an appointment.

title: Awful experience
body: I went to the A&E as advised by 111 GP. I had the following symptoms, fever, sore throat, cough, diarrhea, vomiting for 4 days, then 3rd day my left cheek got swollen, 4th day my left cheeck and jawline and underneath ear got swollen and bit hard underneath ear, and had a blackedout episode which I didn't recall as my 5 year old found me lying on the floor and called his dad. So following all these I called 111 and was advised to go to A&E, checked in, was really busy which I understand, waited for 3 hours before an assessment. After 3 hours when I went for the assessment I was shaky, dizzy and barely able to stand up. The "nurse" who did the assessment didn't write anything except, came with a fever. She asked me to go and sit in the waiting area and while struggling to stand I remember her saying, just go and stop wasting time, and before I knew, I fell and blackedout, don't remember a single incident. Ended up in Escalation zone. Not once did the "nurse" tried to help or even write the true description of everything I said to her.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Not a great experience
body: Visited children's a&e a few times , had to wait up to 13 hours with an newborn baby who's unwell. Nurses didn't speak to me in a professional way. Didn't help out newborn out and had to travel to a different hospital for future care who actually helped us.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: doctors and nurses  let down by reception / admin
body: From the moment you‚Äôve argued with the telephone system to get through to a receptionist who then has no idea on the urgency of a situation and treats you in a patronising manner because you don‚Äôt understand the complications of diary management in the NHS, this surgery used to be good but now it‚Äôs impossible to get appointments especially if you need it when you‚Äôre actually ill and not in 3 weeks time. I‚Äôm told by my doctors/ nurses to state with the receptionist that I‚Äôm asthmatic which is life threatening and need an appointment for antibiotics to help them triage me. That is useless and I‚Äôm told I didn‚Äôt have my last asthma review with a nurse (had covid at the time) so couldn‚Äôt see a doctor. I‚Äôve had asthma since birth, know how to manage it and my inhalers so don‚Äôt need a receptionist to tell me how to manage my condition. They do nothing to show empathy nor willing to accommodate people. Sadly you can‚Äôt book things yourself as when you get to a doctor or nurse they‚Äôre great. You just have to live long enough and plan your illness in advance to get past reception.

title: Felt unsupported
body: Sadly my experience with Talk Liverpool was not what I expected. I was put onto Silvercloud (CBT via my laptop) I found it muddled and with no explanation. I tried to contact via email for help and was told someone would contact me, this never happened, emailed numerous times no response, tried to call and phone rang out then just went dead. The next thing I know is, I have been discharged for not using Silvercloud, which Is untrue as I have tried...I feel this is a shoddy service and really needs looking at. Really disappointed.

author: Silverimage
title: Great overall experience and really well looked after üëç
body:
Went into Grantham and District Hospital for a Right FHL (flexor hallucis longus) tendon transfer. Early morning appointment. I did experience a delay due to unforeseen circumstances, but was then expertly seen to a little later than expected and all went well in the very new surgical ward.  
The Surgeons, the Doctors, Nurses and auxiliary staff were all superb and cannot praise highly enough. Throughout the whole procedure from my surgeon Mr Hossain and everyone else involved it was a real eye-opener to receive the highest level of care throughout.  
Once back in recovery, I received care second to none and of course a long awaited Cup of Tea! In particular, not wishing to exclude anyone, I think Lorraine? Alias definitely Lottie! was absolutely fantastic and we had a right laugh, but so professional and I couldn‚Äôt have asked for better care. Also I would like to mention Iwona - again care with a constant smile and really looked after me above and beyond.  
Many Thanks to those mentioned and also to everyone else involved from the bottom of my heart!  
Thank you üòä

links.id: very well looked after and cared for
i felt that i mattered and not just a number

title: Great nurses
body:
I broke my wrist and went A & E at Wexham. On arrival I was welcomed and check in rapidly. I only waited 10 minutes and a nurse called me to be examined. She was so kind and gentle and offered me pain relief. While in the waiting area she came and found me and gave me some paracetamol and water. Approximately 15 minutes later I was called for an X-ray. The original nurse called me back to the examination room where she told me my wrist bones were impacted and needed resetting. She said there was a specialist nurse coming to perform manipulation as she could not do this for me. She reassured me that I would be give pain relief. Back in the waiting area for only 20 minutes or so then a lovely Nurse Practitioner called me through to the treatment area. He thoroughly explained the damage to my wrist and what he had to do to put it right.
He was assisted by two other nurses while he pulled my impacted wrist bones apart and positioned my wrist in a suitable position. Then he applied a plaster cast. I was given great pain relief during this procedure. He and the other nurses made me laugh and put me at ease. They were all wonderful. I was then referred to fracture clinic which was also run by brilliant staff. I had regular appointments and X-rays. The X-ray department staff were also very kind and professional. My wrist successfully healed. I give thanks to the marvellous staff in the plaster room a brilliant bunch of ladies. My last appointment in fracture clinic I saw a wonderful young doctor who explained the result of my fracture and that one of the bones had shorted as a result of the break he showed great concern and kindness and and reassured me. He said he would arrange physio would see me again in eight weeks. He was marvellous explaining everything and genuinely cared. Less than a week after having my cast removed a lady from Physio phoned to book me in for physio. What fantastic staff their computer system may be tricky but with such amazing staff you wouldn‚Äôt know. I start my physio in two weeks. Very grateful thanks to all the staff I was treated by. You are wonderful amazing people.

title: Great practice
body:
The staff were very friendly and kept me up to date with everything. 
Would definitely recommend this hospital.

title: Good luck trying to get an appointment
body:
Monday, went in at 9am and was told fully booked but not even one person sat waiting to see a doctor

Tuesday 8am - went in to be told they were only doing half day because of training so only 3 appts left 9am, 9:30 or 10am. What happens after 10am? They need training on diary management for crying out loud, surely training starts after lunch????

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: Impossible to get an appointment. They tell you ring at 8am for an appointment but the phone line is constantly engaged as they are obviously so busy with everyone having been told the exact same thing. You cannot even get through to queue in the automated system - that is how busy the phones are!! After this time there are no appointments available for the rest of the day and you are then told to ring the next day at 8am where you go through the entire debacle again. Ridiculous system and I'm looking for another GP practice now as this is just unacceptable.

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have a really positive attitude
body:
I came to Daisy Hill Hospital after my doctor recommended that I should. My experience in the Emergency Department was an absolute nightmare. I had a very long wait with no bed. I came in mid afternoon and it wasn't until late that night that I got a bed. I really needed to lie down during my time in the ED but I couldn't. All the staff were 100% however.  
After being moved up onto the Male Medical Ward it has been absolutely 100%. Again, all the staff have been 100% up here. They have a really positive attitude - I really couldn't say a bad word about the staff. There has been that many that I cannot remember any names in particular. The staff have all explained everything very well also.  
Everything has been good for me up on the ward and I have been kept comfortable. The domestic staff have also kept the ward incredibly clean. I have no suggestions for improvement.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Terrible reception staff
body: Just had the absolute worst experience when trying to book an appointment for my son. Kept getting cut off when trying to explain the problem, being told I could only be seen for one of the reasons I was calling and made to feel stupid. Was told when I tried to call the day before that I had to call in the morning to make an appointment, and when I called bang on 8am, I'm told there's only 1 appointment left in another surgery and that he can only be seen for one reason! Terrible service, very very rude staff.

title: Poor service
body:
Surgery open telephone lines for daily appointments with doctors at 0830 am.
I called at 0831, automated message stating, queue in front of you is full, you have to call next day.
For approx. a week, I am not able to take an appointment.

title: Disgusting staff!
body:
Rude staff. Can never get an appointment.  My 6year old daughter covered in a rash, high temp, sore throat. Called 111. She needs to be seen within 24 hour and they couldn't provide that and staff were very rude. 
Cant travel but told me to travel to seek help. Absolutely useless. Can never get an appointment for an adult and now I'm disgusted as I can't get one for a child either.

author: snowxe83
title: The staff were absolutely amazing.
body:
The staff members went above and beyond for us to make sure we had everything we needed and were cared for.  
We unfortunately sat in resus for around 7 hours before being moved to the PAU. But once there I can‚Äôt complain about anything and the staff were absolutely amazing.

title: Cannot get appointments
body:
After trying 288 (yes you read that right) times I finally got in the telephone queue! Took me 20 minutes to get from 26th to 1st in the queue so at 8.30 I finally spoke to someone who said sorry no appointments left! Please contact NHS 111 I politely informed them that NHS 111 had told me to contact me GP for an appointment today and they said, you will need to go to a walk in centre. 
They have oversubscribed themselves and have too many patients to deal with and its the patients that are loosing out.
Avoid if you can.

title: Telephone trials and tribulations
body: This review relates solely to the difficulties encountered in phoning for an appointment at 8:00am. The response suggests the call is connected and it is then necessary to listen to a long message before connecting to reception, at which stage (every call) I was in was promptly disconnected, despite calling at 8:00am on the dot. Reading others' experiences too, it would seem the current system is not working well in terms of patient experience. If, following repeated attempts to get into a queue (at e.g. no 13), a long wait ensues with no indication there will be no appointments left by the time the call is answered. It is no longer possible to call in person at 8:00am, as the doors open at 8.30am, by which time there are no appointments left. It is like Russian Roulette, as to whether one can connect to a receptionist or not! I believe the current system needs addressing as soon as possible. I have positive experiences of face to face contact with the nurses and GP's and think this aspect lets the surgery down. Given such a positive previous CQC report, it seems  a pity that this aspect, of communication and accessibility lets down what is a great surgery, and when this could be resolved for the benefit of all. The current system seems very difficult for both patients and receptionists, who seem stressed out by it also.

title: Awful Service
body: 19/12: Joined the car park queue at 7.25am, got to the desk at 0815, no face2face or phone appointments. Explained I was waiting for urgent cancer results, told to come back tomorrow and queue again. 20/12: Joined the queue at 07:10, got to the desk at 0810, no face2face or phone appointment, explained again that I was waiting for urgent results, receptionist totally unsypathtic... come back tomorrow. How is this a service?

title: Poor
body: Sent in my E consultation as it was impossible to break through on the phone to make an actual appointment , received a reply that a doctor will phone me in 10 days time between 08:00 and 18:00 to discuss my symptoms ! I‚Äôm looking forward to monitoring my phone for 10 hours that day and hoping my symptoms don‚Äôt worsen by then over the Xmas period !

title: Great
body: I had an appointment with the phlebotomist at this practice. I was seen on time by the nurse. She was lovely, very friendly and caring, asking me if I was frightened of needles.
